alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 07 at 8:34AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion western Cumberland county. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 832 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated areas of heavy rain. Localized minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Localized rainfall amounts of between 1 and 3 inches have been reported. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carlisle, Shippensburg, Plainfield, Schlusser, Newville, Bloserville, Walnut Bottom, Carlisle Springs, Newburg, Shippensburg University and Penn State Dickinson School Of Law. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
